@Andrew Allen _please do iterate on the prompts and we can discuss merging your work back into the code when you think you've got something better. Refer to completion - that's a templated paragraph, not a GenAI thing. If you want to create a better intro paragraph, assume you have the candidate profile and the 3 recommended jobs & the pitch._
Save
Cancel
Andrew Allen
June 6, 2024 at 12:10 AM - Internal note
Thanks all!
@Dennys Yefimenko Let us know if you encounter any issues implementing the new html. We can revise-resupply html if any design tweaks are needed (e.g. if you can't port the company logos and/or 'metadata chip' values via the SFP API, we could remove those fields from v1 and troubleshoot for v2... but it might look bad if they were removed without adjusting the job card layout).
Lastly:
1. When it's ready to start deploying, please send test mails to me and vinodh@zamstars.com, ideally with real data, so we double check the variable fields and clickthru URLs etc.
2. I assume the adjustments to trigger criteria have been made. Please let me know if anything had to deviate away from what I outlined in my earliest comments on this ticket.
3. Thank you for updating the GenAI prompts after my last feedback. This meets my MVP Q8 now, so doesn't have to be a blocker for v1, but there's still room for improvement.

content.title: Email from Dragos Nuta to Bogdan, Steven
content.visibleText:
Dragos Nuta <dragos.nuta@trilogy.com> to Bogdan, Steven
Hi Steven,

We should. Adding Bogdan as we both look at this with a lot of interest.
Can you use this link to schedule a call?

Dragos

content.title: Email from Steven Conway to Bogdan Tenea
content.visibleText:
Steven Conway (glean.com), Bogdan Tenea (bogdan.tenea@trilogy.com)
Hi Steven,

I think that the next session should be primarily a technical one.
We know well what we want and we've been evaluating similar solutions. How can we make this hyper-focused and efficient?
We can even prepare test data and use...

activitySummary: The user starts by checking their email on Gmail. The inbox shows various emails, including updates from LinkedIn, technical reviews, and meeting invitations. The user seems to be prioritizing their tasks by reviewing emails from different sources, including Google, LinkedIn, and internal communications. This indicates the user is organizing their tasks and preparing for upcoming meetings and projects.

Next, the user navigates to a Jira task on the WorkSmart Lambda project. The task involves including job recommendations in rejection emails. The user is seen adding internal notes and replying to a customer. The comments suggest the user is iterating on prompts and discussing the integration of new HTML designs. This activity shows the user is actively involved in project management and task coordination.

Finally, the user returns to Gmail to follow up on an email thread regarding Glean use cases and MNDA. The email content indicates a discussion about scheduling a call and preparing for a technical session. The user is coordinating with colleagues to ensure the next session is focused and efficient. This activity highlights the user's role in communication and planning for technical discussions.
aiUseSummary: There is no evidence of AI tools being used in the provided screenshots. The user is primarily engaged in email communication and project management tasks on Jira. No AI chat interfaces or AI-generated suggestions are visible in the screenshots, indicating that the user did not utilize AI tools during this period.
